body.p: Bruce was born on August 18, 1825 in lexington Kentucky In 1850, Bruce is listed as a China Merchant. In 1860, Bruce is listed as the county county clerk in Fayette County, Kentucky. In the same year, he formed the Lexington Chasseurs, a military group based in Lexington, Kentucky. At the outbreak of the Civil War, Bruce was commissioned as a Colonel of the 29th Regiment, Kentucky Infantry on October 1, 1861 in Lexington, Kentucky. He commanded the 22nd Brigade of the 4th Division of the Army of the Ohio at the battle of Shiloh. He commanded in several different roles during the Civil War after the battle of Shiloh including the Corinth Campaign, being named military commander if the Bowling Green, Kentucky region and then Provost Martial of Lexington, Kentucky He resigned his position in the Army due to ill health on June 24, 1864. Bruce died on January 31, 1902 in New York, New York.
